intro: Triphora trianthophoros subsp. trianthophoros, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a unique flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It is characterized by its striking, translucent, waxy flowers that resemble ghostly apparitions, hence its common name. The plant belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is notable for its unusual morphology, including its fleshy, leaf-like structures. It thrives in arid environments and is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and limited water availability. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is considered a vulnerable species.
